nodes.text: Lux was a modified Seeker droid who was used for security in the Glow Dome a nightclub located on the planet Adarlon. He was heavily armed and modified by Dr. Lytos Urtell.

Lux was purchased used by Glow Dome co-owner Corinna A'Daasha and heavily modified by Doctor Lytos Urtell. The droid was originally programmed hunt and track criminals but Urtell added programming and armaments turned the droid into a potent security guard.

The droid retained its law enforcement programming to find and detect criminals. Although the droid was a tiny sphere it had been programmed to talk like a grizzled cop, a veteran of the streets. Lux did not tolerate any back-talk. Lux did not trust Doctor Urtell and told this to Corinna repeatedly.

As a Seeker droid, Lux had powerful sensors and programming that allowed gave him the ability to track individuals down to a genetic level and analyze individuals for potential threats. His ability to identify criminals made Dr. Urtell nervous as he was conducting several illegal operations at the time. Doctor Urtell tried to get Lux in for a maintenance overhaul but the droid correctly determined that the Sullustan doctor was a potential threat.
Armed with a Merr-Sonn Model MSD-32 Disruptor Pistol and a BlasTech Persuader heavy stun gun, Lux was a floating armory that could enforce security by extremely deadly force.

Lux was designed by Paul Danner and Bill Smith for Wretched Hives of Scum & Villainy, a supplement for the Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game that was published by West End Games in 1997. He was illustrated by Tom O'Neill.
